text:
CHANNEL
KFME
FARGO,
MOORHEAD
NORTH CENTRAL EDUCATIONAL TELEVISION ASSOCIATION, INC.
HIGHWAY 81 SOUTH
FARGO. N. DAK. 58101
Area 701 232-8921
February 17, 1966
James Fellows
Assistant to the President
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue
Washington, D.C.
Dear Jim:
Enclosed is the financial statement for the Library for January, 1966, I
spent the better part of three days in Austin last week and must say that
I am less than happy about things* I would have written this sooner but
have spent the better part of this week being sick.
The problems in Austin are still the same and they will not get any better,
I am convinced that there will never be any help from Bob. He is neither
interested in or able to straighten out the personality problems between Marye
and Earl. 1^11 bring you up to date on the project subject by subject.
Kit Number 3
Distribution proceeding but the volume of bookings has decreased. Business
may kick up when more titles are available and new brochure is sent out.
Kit Number 5
The first release print was finally received and looked at. It is acceptable
but the sound is erratic. I asked Earl to check it and he claimed it sounded
okay to him. Even though it isn»t a first quality recording job, getting it
out is important and it isn»t that bad. I was supposed to receive the rest
of the release prints by Wednesday of this week (February 16, 1966) but as
usual I didn^t.
Kit Number 2
Earl is currently printing up the shooting of this script. I saw a rough,
rough cut, interlocks of about one half of the script. I feel that this was
a complete shamble. At this time I donH even know how it will turn out.
The footage is not like the script but then the script is impossible. I tried
to talk with Earl and Marye about the problems but got absolutely no where.
It was left that Earl would finish the interlock cut and then I’ll just have
to go look at it and will have to re-edit until it comes out like something.
